description: Retrieves information about a managed container fleet deployment. If successful, a FleetDeployment object is returned.

parameters.name: FleetId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the container fleet. You can use either the fleet ID or ARN value.

nested_items.name: FleetDeployment
nested_items.description: The requested deployment information.

nested_items.name: DeploymentId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the deployment.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the container fleet.

nested_items.name: GameServerBinaryArn
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the game server container group definition that is being deployed.

nested_items.name: RollbackGameServerBinaryArn
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the game server container group definition to roll back to if deployment fails. Amazon GameLift sets this property to the container group definition version that the fleet used when it was last active.

nested_items.name: PerInstanceBinaryArn
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the per-instance container group definition that is being deployed.

nested_items.name: RollbackPerInstanceBinaryArn
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the version of the per-instance container group definition to roll back to if deployment fails. Amazon GameLift sets this property to the container group definition version that the fleet used when it was last active.

nested_items.name: DeploymentStatus
nested_items.description: The status of fleet deployment activity in the location.
IN_PROGRESS --- The deployment is in progress.
IMPAIRED --- The deployment failed and the fleet has some impaired containers.
COMPLETE --- The deployment has completed successfully.
ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS --- The deployment failed and rollback has been initiated.
ROLLBACK_IN_COMPLETE --- The deployment failed and rollback has been completed.
CANCELLED --- The deployment was cancelled.

nested_items.name: DeploymentConfiguration
nested_items.description: Instructions for how to deploy updates to a container fleet and what actions to take if the deployment fails.

nested_items.name: ProtectionStrategy
nested_items.description: Determines how fleet deployment activity affects active game sessions on the fleet. With protection, a deployment honors game session protection, and delays actions that would interrupt a protected active game session until the game session ends. Without protection, deployment activity can shut down all running tasks, including active game sessions, regardless of game session protection.

nested_items.name: MinimumHealthyPercentage
nested_items.description: Sets a minimum level of healthy tasks to maintain during deployment activity.

nested_items.name: ImpairmentStrategy
nested_items.description: Determines what actions to take if a deployment fails. If the fleet is multi-location, this strategy applies across all fleet locations. With a rollback strategy, updated fleet instances are rolled back to the last successful deployment. Alternatively, you can maintain a few impaired containers for the purpose of debugging, while all other tasks return to the last successful deployment.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A time stamp indicating when this data object was created. Format is a number expressed in Unix time as milliseconds (for example "1469498468.057").

nested_items.name: LocationalDeployments
nested_items.description: If the deployment is for a multi-location fleet, the requests returns the deployment status in each fleet location.

nested_items.name: DeploymentStatus
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: DeploymentStatus
nested_items.description: The status of fleet deployment activity in the location.
IN_PROGRESS --- The deployment is in progress.
IMPAIRED --- The deployment failed and the fleet has some impaired containers.
COMPLETE --- The deployment has completed successfully.
ROLLBACK_IN_PROGRESS --- The deployment failed and rollback has been initiated.
ROLLBACK_IN_COMPLETE --- The deployment failed and rollback has been completed.
CANCELLED --- The deployment was cancelled.
